edu.cmu.lti.oaqa.bio.resource_wrapper.db_wrapper

Class ResourceDBWrapper

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cmu.lti.oaqa.bio.resource_wrapper.db_wrapper.ResourceDBWrapper

  • public class ResourceDBWrapper
extends java.lang.Object
    Object for interfacing with the resources database.
    Version:
    0.2.1
    Author:
    Collin McCormack (cmccorma)

      • insertTerm

        public void insertTerm(java.lang.String term)
                throws java.sql.SQLException
        Insert a new term into the database. Term existence is tested before insertion, no action is taken if the term already exists.
        Parameters:
        term - Term to insert (must be unique in the db)
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - Thrown in the case of a database error or bad SQL statement

      • insertTerm

        public void insertTerm(Term term)
                throws java.sql.SQLException
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
        See Also:
        insertTerm(String)

      • deleteTerm

        public void deleteTerm(java.lang.String term)
                throws java.sql.SQLException
        Delete an existing term in the database. Checks for existence of term before attempting deletion. If the term is not in the database, no action is taken. Term deletions cascade to the 'term' and 'valueTerm' columns in the 'termRelationships' table!
        Parameters:
        term - String to delete from the database
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - Thrown in the case of a database error or bad SQL statement

      • deleteTerm

        public void deleteTerm(Term term)
                throws java.sql.SQLException
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
        See Also:
        deleteTerm(String)

      • getTermByRelationshipAndValue

        public java.lang.String getTermByRelationshipAndValue(java.lang.String relationship,
                                                      java.lang.String toTerm)
                                               throws java.sql.SQLException
        This is a vague method. It should ONLY be used to look for ID's as those are guaranteed to be unique. It will probably fail spectacularly for anything else. It will only return the first result of the query.
        Parameters:
        relationship - String to query on relationship column
        toTerm - String value to query on valueTerm column
        Returns:
        String term if found, else null
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • hasRelationships

        public boolean hasRelationships(java.lang.String term)
                         throws java.sql.SQLException
        Tests for whether a term is part of a relationship in the database.
        Parameters:
        term - String to query on
        Returns:
        true if the term has relationships, false if it doesn't (or on error)
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - Thrown in the case of a database error or bad SQL statement

                                                       throws java.sql.SQLException

        Parameters:

      • getRelationshipsOlderThan

        public java.util.ArrayList<TermRelationship> getRelationshipsOlderThan(java.util.Date datetime)
                                                                throws java.sql.SQLException
        Retrieve all TermRelationship rows that were last updated before the datetime parameter. (Should be used for updating the database.)
        Parameters:
        datetime -
        Returns:
        ArrayList of TermRelationship's
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - Thrown in the case of a database error or bad SQL statement

                               java.lang.String parentTerm)
                        throws java.sql.SQLException

        relationship -
        toTerm -
        confidence -
        origin -
        parentTerm - (null allowable)

        java.sql.SQLException - Thrown in the case of a database error or bad SQL statement

      • updateRelationship

        public void updateRelationship(TermRelationship trOld,
                               TermRelationship trNew)
                        throws java.sql.SQLException
        Update a relationship in the database. The old TermRelationship is entirely replaced with the new TermRelationship. Does not test for similarity between the parameters.
        Parameters:
        trOld - TermRelationship to query for and replace
        trNew - TermRelationship that replaces trOld
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - Thrown in the case of a database error or bad SQL statement

      • deleteRelationship

        public void deleteRelationship(java.lang.String fromTerm,
                               java.lang.String relationship,
                               java.lang.String toTerm)
                        throws java.sql.SQLException
        Delete a TermRelationship from the database. Does not check for existence before attempting deletion!
        Parameters:
        fromTerm -
        relationship -
        toTerm -
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - Thrown in the case of a database error or bad SQL statement

      • getCountForQuery

        public int getCountForQuery(java.lang.String query)
                     throws java.sql.SQLException
        Executes the supplied query containing a 'count()' command. Returns a -1 on error. Ex: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM mytable WHERE importance='high';
        Parameters:
        query - A query containing a 'count()'
        Returns:
        The int result, -1 on error
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • deleteRelationshipsBySource

        public void deleteRelationshipsBySource(Origin source)
                                 throws java.sql.SQLException
        Delete all of the TermRelationship's that have a source that matches the supplied Origin.
        Parameters:
        source - Origin enum representing the source of the information
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • searchTerms

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> searchTerms(java.lang.String termQuery)
                                                  throws java.sql.SQLException
        Search the 'terms' table for entries similar to the parameter 'termQuery'. Spaces in 'termQuery' are replaced with wildcards, also a wildcard prefix and suffix. Whole words are left intact (NOT mutable for matching).
        Parameters:
        termQuery -
        Returns:
        Matching terms
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - Returns an empty ArrayList

      • searchTermRelationships

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> searchTermRelationships(java.lang.String termQuery,
                                                                     Origin source)
                                                              throws java.sql.SQLException
        Search the 'termrelationships' table for 'term' entries similar to the parameter 'termQuery'. Spaces in 'termQuery' are replaced with wildcards, also a wildcard prefix and suffix. Whole words are left intact (NOT mutable for matching). Can also specify the source of the knowledge, Origin.ALL will match all.
        Parameters:
        termQuery -
        source - Origin object representing the source of the knowledge
        Returns:
        ArrayList of Strings of the matching terms
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - Returns and empty ArrayList

      • debugExecQuery

        public java.sql.ResultSet debugExecQuery(java.lang.String query)
                                  throws java.sql.SQLException
        Executes the supplied query. Returns the ResultSet for that query. SHOULD ONLY BE USED FOR DEBUGGING PURPOSES, NEVER IN PRODUCTION CODE!
        Parameters:
        query -
        Returns:
        raw ResultSet
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

        private java.sql.Connection getDBConnection()
                                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Get a connection to the database.
        Returns:
        new Connection to the database
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
